result.execSummary:
The defendant Todd Anthony Clayton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Todd Anthony Clayton

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Todd Anthony Clayton in court with Attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered:    
Charge amended to Theft, a forfeiture, pursuant to Milwaukee County Ordinance 63.042, to which Defendant plead no contest. Court finds defendant guilty of amended charge.
Court orders a forfeiture in the amount of $100.00 inclusive of costs to be paid by 5-05-2020. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Todd Anthony Clayton in court with Attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for return on warrant.  Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Court grants request.  Case adjourned for plea/sentencing to Branch 40.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 6, 2020 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Amanda Poznanski previously in court.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for calendar call.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued with REMAND TO COMMISSIONER.  Court took no action on bail.  Court vacated the jury trial date set for 3-02-2020.
Received and Filed, Defense Motion In Limine.

Defendant Todd Anthony Clayton in court with Attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Anthony Jackson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates.  Court grants request.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 4, 2020 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 2, 2020 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Todd Anthony Clayton in court with Attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Defense requests a status date.  Court grants request.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for December 9, 2019 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court, defendant Todd Anthony Clayton not in court, in custody.  Anthony Jackson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in Court for Calendar call.  Defense requested adjournment of proceedings. Court grants request.  Case remains calendared in Branch 40.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 19, 2019 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court.  Anthony Jackson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case calendared for scheduling conference. Defendant failing to appear. Defense requests a calendar call date. State has no objection. Court grants request.  Calendar call scheduled for October 24, 2019 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. All previously ordered conditions of bail remain.

Defendant Todd Anthony Clayton in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Defendant Todd Anthony Clayton in custody. Student Intern Allison Mignon under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised case is assigned to Judge Danielle Shelton, Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 11, 2019 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500.00 signature bond) gj
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Todd Anthony Clayton not in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for status of counsel.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered Bench Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.

Defendant Todd Anthony Clayton in court pro-se.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defendant may be public defender eligible. Court referred the defendant to public defender's office for eligibility status.   Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail Refund Check Packet
14RM050634 Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:  11/07/14.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Rebecca Z.; Michael F. or Tremell G.

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered any cash bail on deposit to be returned to the remitter.

Defendant Todd Anthony Clayton in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Todd Anthony Clayton in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Defense informs the Court Defendant wishes to proceed pro se.  Upon the Courts questioning, Defendant agrees to Public Defender Representation for this appearance only.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT MAY QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Todd Anthony Clayton not in court.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 3/27/15 @ 1:30 pm
